intro: Ornithogalum ponticum subsp. obconicum, commonly known as the broad-leaved star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features a basal rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a white or pale waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped, white or pale green flowers that are typically arranged in a spike. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable ornamental for garden settings. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
